item.title: Israeli Special Forces Launch Raids Into Lebanon Ahead of Possible Ground Incursion
item.description: The small, targeted raids are aimed at gathering intelligence ahead of a possible broader ground incursion that could come as soon as this week.

item.title: Zelensky Visited U.S. to Seek War Boost. His Most-Important Ally Shrugged.
item.description: Ukrainian troops are slowly losing ground, and officials say more support is needed to hold Russia back.

item.title: Nasrallah's Killing Leaves Hezbollah Diminished---With a Void at the Top
item.description: The Lebanese militant group’s next leader will confront the most challenging moment in the organization’s four-decade history.

item.title: Israel Strikes Targets in Yemen as It Presses Air Campaign Against Hezbollah
item.description: Israel struck power plants and a sea port in Yemen Sunday as the Israeli military continued an air campaign against Hezbollah in Lebanon.

item.title: Far-Right Freedom Party Wins Historic Support in Austria
item.description: The election result reflects a trend across Europe, where an influx of migrants has led to political fragmentation in some countries.

item.title: China to Allow Home Buyers to Refinance Mortgages
item.description: The move is the latest in a weeklong burst of easing measures aimed at stimulating China’s moribund property market.

item.title: Europe's Quest to Rearm Runs Into Red Tape, Lack of Cash---and Meditation
item.description: The effort to get an abandoned Danish ammunition factory restarted exemplifies Europe’s struggle to boost its arms production.

item.title: Hezbollah Misjudged Israel's Weakness and Iran's Might
item.description: A succession of Israeli strikes have reset the military calculus in the Middle East, but it remains just as dangerous.

item.title: How Israel Killed Hezbollah's Leader in Underground Bunker
item.description: The operation was based on intelligence that Hassan Nasrallah would be gathering with other senior leaders.

item.title: U.S. Pushes to Resurrect Cease-Fire Talks After Hezbollah Leader's Death
item.description: Despite escalating violence, some senior U.S. officials are hoping the airstrike that killed Hassan Nasrallah will create an opportunity for negotiations.

item.title: Canadian Grain Terminal Workers Reach Tentative Deal, Ending Strike
item.description: The work stoppage affected six terminals at Port of Vancouver that are critical for exports of canola, wheat, barley and other grains from Canada’s prairies.

item.title: Israeli Airstrike Killed Hezbollah Leader Hassan Nasrallah
item.description: The attack flattened part of a Beirut neighborhood to eliminate the cleric who led the group for three decades and built it into a fearsome foe.

item.title: Hassan Nasrallah's Death Deprives Hezbollah of Its 'Beating Heart'
item.description: The single-most important leader in Iran’s constellation of allied militias turned the Shiite militant group into the world’s most powerful nonstate armed force.

item.title: The $1.7 Billion Takeover Brawl Fueled by a Fear of China
item.description: A battle for control of the world’s largest zinc smelter is dominated by fears it could one day end up in China’s hands.

item.title: Russia and China Defy the West Deep in the Arctic
item.description: A Norwegian archipelago is emerging as a front line in Russia and China’s attempts to dominate trade routes and expand their military presence in the Arctic region, at the expense of the West.

item.title: Israel Takes Aim at Hezbollah Leader Nasrallah in Massive Beirut Airstrike
item.description: The strike flattened multiple buildings in an effort to kill the cleric who built the militant group over 30 years.

item.title: Moody's Lowers Israel's Rating Citing Geopolitical Risks
item.description: Israel’s long-term local and foreign-currency issuer ratings were lowered to Baa1 from A2 and assigned a negative outlook as the intensity of the country’s fighting with Hezbollah has increased in recent days.

item.title: Maggie Smith, Award-Winning Actress and 'Downton Abbey' Star, Dies at 89
item.description: The British actress was already a legend, before winning a new generation of fans as Professor McGonagall in the Harry Potter movies.

item.title: How Israel's Spies Got Blindsided by Hamas but Still Hit Hezbollah Hard
item.description: After dismissing signs of the looming Oct. 7 attacks, Israel now has the enemy it prepared for.

item.title: Song Binbin, China's Most Famous Red Guard, Dies at 77
item.description: She epitomized the deadly fervor of the Cultural Revolution and later apologized for her actions. In the U.S., she was considered just a scientist.
